title: Jane Gross, Sportswriter Who Opened Locker Room Doors, Dies at 75
description: She made news by entering a pro basketball inner sanctum to do her job. Years later, her mother’s physical decline led her to write about aging for The Times and in a book.
dc:creator: Richard Sandomir
media:description: Jane Gross as a Newsday sportswriter, sitting courtside in 1975 during a New York Nets game at Nassau Coliseum on Long Island. Months earlier she had entered the previously “men only” New York Knicks locker room.
